intro: Codonopsis vadsea, commonly known as the Chinese ginseng or dandelion root, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Codonopsis vadsea thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or mountainous regions.
